intro: Meconopsis lancifolia subsp. eximia, commonly known as the Himalayan blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet petals and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
